categories.short_text: Impact of fashion brand on environment

themes.description: Product lifecycle including types of materials used, efforts to reduce fabric and material waste in design and manufacturing, types of packaging used, product durability and promotion of long­term use
How energy use is managed including direct emissions (company facilities and vehicles) and indirect emissions (purchased electricity, emissions generated from the supply chain beyond own operations)
Chemical use and disposal, goals to reduce chemical use and alternatives such as vegetable based or water based dyes
How energy use is managed including direct emissions (company facilities and vehicles) and indirect emissions (purchased electricity, emissions generated from the supply chain beyond own operations)
Does the brand participate in multi-party initiatives to address the environmental impacts of the fashion industry?
Brand’s attempt to campaign against positive environmental initiatives, or whether a brand has been involved in an environmental scandal.

categories.short_text: Impact of fashion brand on workers

themes.description: Brands Assessed in the Ethical Fashion Report
Certified/Accredited Against a High Ranking Standard System

Workers’ rights principles applied across the entire supply chain, including health and safety, child labour, forced labour, freedom of association, freedom of movement, collective bargaining, non­discrimination, non­excessive working hours and the right and capacity to make a complaint
Is the brand’s product range/materials used in the range 100% certified/accredited by any of the following, in the area of supply chain tracing?
Does the brand source any production from high risk and extreme risk countries?
Living wage definition and implementation across the supply chain
Supply chain transparency including publishing supplier lists and tracking subcontractors
Auditing and assurance practices throughout the supply chain and public reporting including unannounced visits and off­site worker interviews
Is the brand a Leading Advocate for better labour rights performance or a social entreprise
Does the brand lobby against labour rights issues or has it been involved in labour right scandals

categories.short_text: Impact of fashion brand on animals

themes.description: Is the brand entirely vegan?
Use of leather and if upcycled/ recycled
Use of wool and if sourced from non-mulesed sheep
Use of down and adopted practices
Use of Fur, Angora or Exotic animal Hairs or Skins
Is the brand a strong and consistent public advocate for animal protection, or has the brand provided leadership on a particular issue?
In the last 3 years, has the brand been involved in any scandals involving use of animals?

questions.text: Has the brand adopted a living wage definition that matches the following definition? Living wage definition: wages and benefits paid for a standard working week that meet at least legal or industry minimum standards, and are sufficient to meet basic needs of workers and their families as well as provide some discretionary income (ILO Conventions 26 and 131).
